conbody.p: This section discusses parts of speech that are easily confused and gives guidelines on how to tag such cases.

section.title: CC or DT
section.p: When they are the first members of the double conjunctions both...and, either...or and neither...nor, both, either and neither are tagged as coordinating conjunctions (CC), not as determiners (DT).
section.codeblock: Either/CC a boy could sing or/CC a girl could dance. Either/CC a boy or/CC a girl could sing. Either/CC a boy or/CC girl could sing.
section.p: Be aware that either or neither can sometimes function as determiners (DT) even in the presence of or or nor.
section.codeblock: Either/DT boy or/CC girl could sing.

section.title: CD or JJ
section.p: Number-number combinations should be tagged as adjectives (JJ) if they have the same distribution as adjectives.
section.codeblock: a 50-3/JJ victory; cf. a handy/JJ victory
section.p: Hyphenated fractions one-half, three-fourths, seven-eighths, one-and-a-half, seven-and-three-eighths should be tagged as adjectives (JJ) when they are prenominal modifiers, but as adverbs (RB) if they could be replaced by double or twice.
section.codeblock: one-half/J J cup; cf. a full/JJ cup one-half/RB the amount; cf. twice/RB the amount; double/RB the amount
